net.sf.mmm.search.api.config

Interface SearchSource

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeReadId<String>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    SearchIndexerSource, SearchSourceView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SearchIndexerSourceBean, SearchSourceBean, SearchSourceViewBean

    public interface SearchSource
extends AttributeReadId<String>
    This is the interface for the configuration of a source of information for the search-engine (e.g. some VCS-instance, a wiki or some website).
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    getId()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ID_ANY
      The ID of the SearchSource that represents any source.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getId()
      This method gets the ID of this source.
      String getTitle()
      This method gets the display-name of this source.
      String getUrlPrefix()
      This method gets the prefix for the URL pointing to the content of a SearchEntry.

    • Field Detail

      • ID_ANY

        static final String ID_ANY
        The ID of the SearchSource that represents any source. In a search it can be used as wildcard to match all sources.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        This method gets the ID of this source. The ID should be a short, technical and unique name that identifies the source within your list of sources (e.g. "SVN", "Wiki", "MyDocuments", "apache.org"). This ID will be added to the search-index for each according entry. A SearchQuery can be restricted to specific sources via their IDs.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadId<String>
        Returns:
        the ID of this source.
        See Also:
        SearchEntry.getSource()

      • getTitle

        String getTitle()
        This method gets the display-name of this source. This title can be displayed to end-users in the application where a SearchQuery is performed so the user can restrict his search to specific sources.
        For localization see net.sf.mmm.util.nls.api.
        Returns:
        the title of this source.

      • getUrlPrefix

        String getUrlPrefix()
        This method gets the prefix for the URL pointing to the content of a SearchEntry. The URL that links to this content is build by appending the URI of the SearchEntry to this prefix.
        Typical examples are "http://foo.org/svn/trunk" or "http://foo.org/wiki/".
        Returns:
        the URL-prefix of this source.
